abstract: Just because Google spent $1.65 billion to acquire YouTube and is swimming in cash doesn’t mean that Google will seek a major deal again anytime soon, according to its chief executive. Reuters said that at Morgan Stanley’s technology conference, Eric Schmidt, responding to a question by analyst Mary Meeker, said that it’s “highly unlikely” the company will change course on how it uses cash.
lead_paragraph: Just because Google spent $1.65 billion to acquire YouTube and is swimming in cash doesn’t mean that Google will seek a major deal again anytime soon, according to its chief executive. Reuters said that at Morgan Stanley’s technology conference, Eric Schmidt, responding to a question by analyst Mary Meeker, said that it’s “highly unlikely” the company will change course on how it uses cash.

headline.main: Google C.E.O. Plays Down Deal Talk
